content.raw: If it is alright with you I would like to not include them because they are used in the API define in `Batch.hh`. Adding them makes it possible for the build to succeed even if `Batch.hh` was missing those includes. Not including them means we catch that at compile time instead of a user catching it at their compile time.
content.html: If it is alright with you I would like to not include them because they are used in the API define in Batch.hh. Adding them makes it possible for the build to succeed even if Batch.hh was missing those includes. Not including them means we catch that at compile time instead of a user catching it at their compile time.

update.description:
WIP. This pull request is intended to add record/playback capability using ignition-tools.

Done:

* Record topics using `ign log record`
* `Log` class handles inserting topics/messages into a log file
* `Record` class handles subscribing to ignition transport
* Simple unit tests for `Log` class
* Simple unit tests for `Record` class

TODO:

* Add `Playback` class to compliment `Record`
* Playback command line implementation using `Playback` class
* Implement `Log` API to query messages (see [this confluence page](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GAZ/pages/99778575/Ignition+Log))
    * `Message` class
    * `TimeOptions` class
    * `TopicOptions` class
    * `MessageIterator` class (in wiki discussion)
* Tests for `Log` that use playback API to verify record AP
* Record needs to use raw-bytes subscriber (pull request #251)
* Integration tests for record and playback

Questions for @caguero :

* How can record get notified of new topics? For example, record may be launched before the thing it is supposed to record starts recording. Record would only be subscribed to the ones it saw at launch.

New dependencies

 * ignition-common0
 * SQLite3
 * ruby-ffi
update.title: [WIP] ignition tools record/playback

content.raw:
+1 to `ign-common1`

Isn't this PR introducing a new required dependency on ign-common in any case? I understand that is a different library but there's no way to compile Ignition Transport without log support, right?
content.html:
+1 to ign-common1

Isn't this PR introducing a new required dependency on ign-common in any case? I understand that is a different library but there's no way to compile Ignition Transport without log support, right?

content.raw:
We can't use `ign_find_package` here until we get the [Components pull request merged](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/pull-requests/2). It's only the `log` component of the project that currently depends on `ign-common0`, so using `ign_find_package` would introduce a new required dependency to the core `ign-transport` package.

Bumping to `ign-common1` should be totally fine, though.
content.html:
We can't use ign_find_package here until we get the Components pull request merged. It's only the log component of the project that currently depends on ign-common0, so using ign_find_package would introduce a new required dependency to the core ign-transport package.

Bumping to ign-common1 should be totally fine, though.

can this use common1? the pipeline is broken because of this.

also, should this be an `ign_find_package` in the root CMakeLists.txt?

update.description:
WIP. This pull request is intended to add record/playback capability using ignition-tools.

Done:

* Record topics using `ign log record`
* `Log` class handles inserting topics/messages into a log file
* `Record` class handles subscribing to ignition transport
* Simple unit tests for `Log` class
* Simple unit tests for `Record` class

TODO:

* Add `Playback` class to compliment `Record`
* Playback command line implementation using `Playback` class
* Implement `Log` API to query messages (see [this confluence page](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GAZ/pages/99778575/Ignition+Log))
    * `Message` class
    * `TimeOptions` class
    * `TopicOptions` class
    * `MessageIterator` class (in wiki discussion)
* Tests for `Log` that use playback API to verify record AP
* Record needs to use raw-bytes subscriber (pull request #251)
* Integration tests for record and playback

Questions for @caguero :

* How can record get notified of new topics? For example, record may be launched before the thing it is supposed to record starts recording. Record would only be subscribed to the ones it saw at launch.

New dependencies

 * ignition-common0
 * SQLite3
 * ruby-ffi
update.title: [WIP] ignition tools record/playback
